content:
Started a discussion, would appreciate input for those here that are not in the implementers stream
https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179166-implementers/topic/medication.20record
The idea is that we should not discuss forever "what is the ideal flavour of the medication summary" but actually enable the exchange of raw data.
I've been pushing since 2011 because something seemed insufficient with the single-purpose medication summaries.
And I was recently encouraged with the statement"raw data now!" so thanks @Dave deBronkart

Thanks Jose. We are happy to chime in and appreciate you asking the Patient Empowerment Workgroup!

I put my thoughts down: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179166-implementers/topic/medication.20record

Debi Willis

Thank you @Jose Costa Teixeira - yes, yes, yes; as you know (so I'll say it for others), "raw data now" is not my phrase - it's from Tim Berners-Lee in his TEDGlobal 2009 talk! I merely cited it at the end of my TED. Here's his - and the rationale is COMPLETELY spot-on for your use case: https://www.ted.com/talks/tim_berners_lee_the_next_web
What would be the idea to make this data available? Have it as part of the regulatory requirements?
